author: Human1229
title: Playing With Food!
review:
I got this mixel at my local Target, originally looking for Vaka-Waka (which they didn't  have) but settled on this wonderful mixel instead!

Box/Instructions

Nice little polybag with a see through area to see the pieces, instructions are very straightforward and easy to follow.

Parts

Great part assortment in hues of violet and some white. I love the semisphere and 4x4 circular lavender plate with a hole in the center used as stuffed cheeks(you can actually put 1x1 studs and flower buds inside, which also come in the set in lime green, blue, and yellowish-orange)  Teeth, eyes, balljoints, and a circular 2x2 tile belly are nice, however if you want those, they are in lots of other mixels, too

The build

The build uses a lot of SNOT(Studs Not On Top) for the cheeks, feet, arms, and belly and is a short but fun build.

The completed model

Cute, lovely, creative build are just a microscopic percent of adjectives I could use to describe this set. Well done Lego!

Looks like a cross between a spikey frog and a purple human, which only creativity and imagination can create! (And Lego builders too) 

Wonderful!

 

Overall opinion

Snax is an adorable creature from the world of Mixels that I highly recommend to Mixels lover and part salvager alike!

author: Trigger_
title: Good Set, But Only as Good as Spugg
review:
As always, the positives: The Munchos are covered in lavender colored bricks, and Snax here uses the most of his tribe; twelve pieces! But, there are the negatives, too:

  • Studs are exposed on the neck
  • The eyes cannot express differently unless you manually remove and place them back.
  • The inside of the mouth is lavender, which looks really... weird and scary.

Still better than Seismo, again.

author: StevenTheBrick
title: Snax
review:
2/5

 

Building experience is meh as the body is very weak, when compared to the head. The parts are also meh, besides the purple pieces used for Snax's s cheeks. The playability is meh as there isn't much to do besides move. The value is also meh, as the Mixel is also exposed in certain areas such as the neck.
